Situation1: Both have several free evenings this week and can choose any for a date.
Expectation2: Maintain a safe and O39ean work environment.
Situation2: You see a coworker about to walk under a suspended load, and you must shout to warn them instantly.
Story: I’d been looking forward to this week for ages—finally, both my girlfriend and I had a few free evenings. She kept texting me ideas for our date: a new restaurant, a movie, maybe just a walk in the park. I could hear the excitement in her voice, and I wanted to make it special, to show her she’s my priority. But as I stood on the construction site, sweat trickling down my back, my mind was split. I was scanning the area, making sure everything was in order, when I noticed a coworker heading straight under a suspended load. My heart jumped into my throat. I knew I had to act fast, shout, do something—safety was on me, and one mistake could mean disaster. But just as I opened my mouth, my phone buzzed in my pocket—her name lighting up the screen, probably asking about tonight. I felt torn, the weight of both worlds pressing on me, knowing I couldn’t let either down, but realizing I might have to choose which role to answer first.
